summary: This bill, S. 2727, amends the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 to authorize grants for eligible institutions to establish and implement agriculture workforce training programs. These grants aim to promote growth, foster competitiveness, and improve worker training/retention in the agriculture industry. Eligible institutions include various educational entities offering agriculture programs.  The grants will support programs including internships, apprenticeships, and educational workshops, with a portion of the funds designated for recruitment and faculty training. The Secretary of Agriculture is directed to implement the program.
